meanings.definition: To perform less well than expected or required.
meanings.sent1: The team underperformed in the championship game, losing by a large margin.
meanings.sent2: The student underperformed on the test, scoring lower than their classmates.
meanings.sent3: The robot underperformed during the dance competition, moving in slow motion.
meanings.sent4: The car underperformed on the steep hill, struggling to climb upwards.
meanings.sent5: The plant underperformed in the shade, growing much slower than in sunlight.

meanings.definition: To fail to achieve a desired level of performance.
meanings.sent1: The company underperformed this quarter, missing its sales target.
meanings.sent2: The athlete underperformed in the race, finishing far behind the leaders.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick underperformed, leaving the audience unimpressed.
meanings.sent4: The engine underperformed during the test drive, causing the car to stall.
meanings.sent5: The phone underperformed in the battery life test, draining quickly under heavy use.
